discussion.content:
The correct is AC

If a database cannot find the listener, then configure the listener.ora file with the GLOBAL_DBNAME parameter, as shown in the following example

SID_LIST_listener=
(SID_LIST=
 (SID_DESC=
 (GLOBAL_DBNAME=sales.example.com)
 (SID_NAME=sales)
 (ORACLE_HOME=/u01/app/oracle))


https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NETAG/advcfg.htm#NETAG1589

Selected Answer: AC
Answer is AC

If a database cannot find the listener, then configure the listener.ora file with the GLOBAL_DBNAME parameter, as shown in the following example
(https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NETAG/advcfg.htm#NETAG1589)

Selected Answer: AC
Agree with dancymonkey. Also read this page: https://oracle-base.com/articles/misc/oracle-network-configuration#Listener

discussion.content: listener.ora file has no SERVICE_NAME parameter?

questions.question_text: Which are two ways for a database service to be recognized by a listener in Oracle Database 12c? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Static registration in the listener.ora file using the SERVICE_NAME parameter
choices.B: Dynamic Registration by the SMON process
choices.C: Static registration in the listener.ora file using the GLOBAL_DBNAME parameter
choices.D: Dynamic Registration by the PMON process
choices.A: Dynamic Registration by the LREG process

choices.F: The impdp operation creates EMP_DEPT as a view
choices.E: The expdp operation exports the table definitions for tables that are queried in the EMP_DEPT view.
choices.A: The expdp operation exports all rows for tables contained in the defining query of the EMP_DEPT view
choices.B: The impdp operation creates separate tables for each table contained in the defining query of the EMP_DEPT view
choices.D: The impdp operation creates EMP_DEPT as a table
choices.C: The expdp operation exports all rows that are displayed when querying the EMP_DEPT view with no filter

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D E
Go to the question #325

Selected Answer: CD
Answer is CD

Selected Answer: CD
c: Views_as_table: Data Pump exports a table with the same columns as the view and with row data fetched from the view. Data Pump also exports objects dependent on the view, such as grants and constraints. Dependent objects that do not apply to tables (for example, grants of the UNDER object privilege) are not exported.The VIEWS_AS_TABLES parameter can be used by itself or along with the TABLES parameter. If either is used, Data Pump performs a table-mode export.
d) Views_as_table: Specifies that one or more tables in the dump file that were exported as views, should be imported.

questions.question_text:
You ran this command on a source database:
$> expdp hr/hr DIRECTORY=dumpdir DUMPFILE=emp1.dmp VIEWS_AS_TABLES=emp_dept
On the target database, you run this command:
$> impdp hr/hr DIRECTORY=dumpdir DUMPFILE=emp1.dmp VIEWS_AS_TABLES=emp_dept
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)
